segment.source: Learn about requirements that must be met by apps that use the Microsoft advertising libraries before they can be published to the Store.
segment.target: Learn about requirements that must be met by apps that use the Microsoft advertising libraries before they can be published to the Store.

segment.source: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store
segment.target: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store

segment.source: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store
segment.target: Submit an app with ads to the Windows Store

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: After you finish developing your app with ads, you can publish your app to the Windows Dev Center dashboard so it is available in the Windows Store.
segment.target: After you finish developing your app with ads, you can publish your app to the Windows Dev Center dashboard so it is available in the Windows Store.

segment.source: For more information about this process, see Publish Windows apps.
segment.target: For more information about this process, see Publish Windows apps.

segment.source: All apps submitted to the Windows Store must follow the Windows Store Policies and terms specified in the App Developer Agreement.
segment.target: All apps submitted to the Windows Store must follow the Windows Store Policies and terms specified in the App Developer Agreement.

segment.source: Apps that use the Microsoft advertising libraries must meet the additional requirements that are specified in Exhibit E of the App Developer Agreement.
segment.target: Apps that use the Microsoft advertising libraries must meet the additional requirements that are specified in Exhibit E of the App Developer Agreement.
